snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg had sought state approval for an overhaul aimed at correcting management and financial problems.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg is remaking the board of the New York City Housing Authority; under a state measure sought by Bloomberg, approved by the State Legislature and signed by Gov Andrew M Cuomo, board will expand to seven members from four, including three tenant positions instead of one, and eliminating its two highly paid full-time positions.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg had sought state approval for an overhaul aimed at correcting management and financial problems.

headline.main: New York City Housing Board to Add Tenant Representatives and Cut Positions
headline.print_headline: Housing Board to Add Tenants and Cut Its Staff
